meanings.definition: The action of making someone a saint in the Roman Catholic Church.
meanings.sent1: The beatification of Mother Teresa brought joy to many believers.
meanings.sent2: The beatification ceremony was attended by thousands of faithful followers.
meanings.sent3: During the beatification process, the saints must have a heavenly smile!
meanings.sent4: Her beatification was like a divine spotlight shining on her virtuous life.
meanings.sent5: The beatification of the Pope was a radiant moment in the church's history.

meanings.definition: The state of being blissfully happy.
meanings.sent1: After receiving the good news, she was in a state of beatification.
meanings.sent2: The beatification on her face was evident after she won the award.
meanings.sent3: His beatification was so contagious that everyone around him smiled.
meanings.sent4: In the garden, she found beatification in the beauty of the blooming flowers.
meanings.sent5: The beatification of their marriage was reflected in their loving gazes.
